name: Hilton Crystal City at Washington Reagan National Airport

reviews.text: Stayed here when my flight misconnected. As I travel on airline staff passes, I paid my own room and for $249, I thought it was not great value considering this is not a city hotel (i.e., a Washington DC hotel) and that very little made it stand out from your average airport Hilton.
reviews.title: Staff made it better than what it really is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have business in Crystal City, this would be a good choice as there are several restaurants to which you can actually walk. The rooms are your standard airport Hilton fare.....large, clean and this one had a flat screen tv although the choice of channels was a little limited. Room service was tasty and fast.
reviews.title: OK Location, but not for Memorial Day Weekend

reviews.text: What made this hotel stand out was the exceptional service at the front desk staff. Both check-in clerks were extremely efficient, courteous and accommodating, and remembered me by name when I came down to the lobby to smoke a cigarette.
reviews.title: Great location IF you are doing business in Crystal City

reviews.text: The Crystal City Hilton is a good choice if overnighting at National Airport or for business in Crystal City.
reviews.title: Beward of additional charges...

reviews.text: Was attending a performance at the signature theatre and wanted a hotel that wasn’t too far and was close to DCA Airport.
reviews.title: This Hotel Is Not Safe

reviews.text: There are times when traveling where you truly get to see if customer service is important to a hotel and I had this opportunity recently at the Hilton. I was traveling with a school group that consisted of 11 muti-handicapped students (all in wheelchairs) and 17 adult companions for a 6 day trip to DC.
reviews.title: Friendly staff stand out

reviews.text: On the plus side, the proximity to National Airport is a great plus, Crystal City blue line Metro stop is an easy 5 block walk away, there are numerous restaurants in the area, including across the street, and getting into the heart of DC is no problem. Rooms are quite nice, bathrooms certainly functional. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant (not included) was very good.
reviews.title: Disappointing
OK, but give it some time
reviews.text: Downside: Internet access is $13 per 24 hours, pool was closed while we were there, bar area is functional but feels more like an add-on.

reviews.title: The Hilton was great!
reviews.text: I can't emphasize enough, however, that the staff, from management to front desk, bell hops to restaurant wait staff, were simply fantastic!! Our group had many needs, and there was never a time where the staff wouldn't make sure a matter was addressed promptly and correctly. When a wheelchair we had rented broke, we were able to borrow a hotel wheelchair for 2 days with no hesitation. When there was not a room in our group that would permit a person in a wheelchair to fully utilize the bathroom, we were given a complimentary room that had one. In every instance, this was truly customer service!
If you're not going to stay in the District itself, or are sticking to No. VA, this hotel would be a good choice.
reviews.title: paper thin walls
Try Elsewhere - Way Too Noisy
reviews.text: It's unfortunate the Hilton Chrystal City is not more soundproof, otherwise it would be a great place to stay, if you need to be close to Reagan or even downtown.

reviews.title: Rotten night's sleep
reviews.text: The staff are actually quite good, and very helpful. I was considering taking the metro to L'Enfant Plaza, and the desk person was prepared to have the Airport Bus take me the 4 blocks to the Metro station. She indicated it was their business and priority to help guests in whatever way they can - wonderful.
Likewise the staff in the HHonors Lounge were very attentive. Great work.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

likes.liked: — Modern decor, good bed and great TV with lots of channels
likes.disliked: — A little bit of dust on the bedside lamps - my only quibble

reviews.text: Unfortunately, sleeping at this Hilton is impossible unless your hard of hearing. The walls a paper thin - you can hear voices and TV from the next rooms. When people leave their room and let the doors slam shut - the whole room resounds with this sonic boom. For goodness sake someone invent a door closer that is silent but effective, or just show some courtesy to fellow travellers.
reviews.title: Good for a weekend in DC

reviews.text: In the morning the 5 lanes of traffic outside the window stopped me from sleeping anytime past about 7:30 AM. Oh yes, the air conditioner also sounded like a wounded Boeing 747 trying to take off. We're talking LOUD. Had to crank it down to cold as possible so I could turn it off and hope room stayed cool until morning.
reviews.title: Decent Place to stay

likes.liked: — comfort of the beds and the maid service
likes.disliked: — Size of the rooms were small

reviews.text: This hotel was going through renovations when I stayed there. I'm sure they have been completed by now and there was no real problems with it then. The staff was more than accomodating. Paul the barkeep was great! Even the engineer who came to fix the TV when it wasn't working properly had a lot of advice on what to do in DC. The valets were very quick and efficient and seemed to know exactly what we were looking for when we asked where to go for the nightlife. The restaurant was decent and that's all I expected. I will be back again.
reviews.title: Paul was awesome!

reviews.text: I was here on a Saturday night (12-20-08) the weekend before christmas '08 and it didnt seem to be too crowed. THe room was nice and well furnished however the tub filled with water cause the drain was obviously stopped up and it took the water 10 minutes to even get warm. What a waist of water!! I'm not exagerating about the 10 minutes either. The room was clean tho. It was quiet, but I'm not sure if that was because it wasnt crowed or not. I stayed on one of the 9th floor. The location is fairly good for walking and just ok access to the subway. Shuttle is available. I would definitly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Business Traveler good hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a conference which was held at Arlington Cemetery. Great location, a few blocks walk to the metro, very convenient. The hotel is also a block away from the new part of Crystal City where they are new restaurants and bars, a nice little area. If you come out of the hotel and go left, you will enter the older part of Crystal City, but there is a sports bar, Crystal City Sports bar...one of the best sport bars I have been in. 3 floors of HD flat screen tv's, good pub food and many bears on tap, can't really go wrong.
reviews.title: Good location, large room, comfy bed, overall nice stay

likes.disliked: — No free internet in room, no coffee in lobby

reviews.text: Hotel is clean, updated with flat screens. A nice stay if you need to stay outside the heart of nice DC.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

likes.disliked: — Business Center charges to use computer - and its not cheap!

reviews.text: Hotel is average for a Hilton - nothing extraordianary but good quality (should be for $200+ a night). Room was comfortable and included good coffee maker / coffee and iron / board but no M/W and no refrigerator. Toiletries provided were excellent. Bed very comfortable; nice flat screen TV with HBO and basic cable only.
reviews.title: Convenient to Reagan National Airport

aka: Hilton Crystal City At Washington Reagan National Airport Hotel
description: Adjacent to Reagan National Airport (DCA), the Hilton Crystal City at Washington Reagan National Airport hotel is 10 minutes from downtown Washington DC in Arlington, VA. Nearby Crystal City Metro station is your best bet to visit National Monuments, Government Agencies and Museums.
